intro: Spermacoce ipecacuana, commonly known as Brazilian ipecac, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn red when mature, containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
